title: Smoked Trout Cucumber & Rye Tartine
description: A bright, savory open-faced sandwich featuring smoky trout, cool crisp cucumber, tangy crème fraîche and dill on toasted rye. Quick to assemble, it balances rich seafood flavors with fresh herbs, lemon and crunchy rye for a satisfying lunch or light dinner.

ingredients.display_name: smoked trout fillets, skin removed and flaked
cucumber, thinly sliced (preferably English or Persian)

ingredients.notes: or full-fat Greek yogurt as substitute
use zest and about 1 tbsp juice
roughly 2 tbsp, rinsed if very salty

ingredients.display_name: unsalted butter (room temperature) or olive oil for toasting
ingredients.notes: about 1 tbsp butter or 1 tbsp olive oil

steps.text: Prepare the crème fraîche spread: combine crème fraîche, half the chopped dill, lemon zest, a squeeze of lemon juice, minced shallot, a pinch of salt and a few grinds of black pepper in a bowl; mix until smooth and refrigerate briefly to meld.
Toast the rye: brush each slice lightly with melted butter or olive oil and toast in a skillet over medium heat or in a toaster until golden and crisp on both sides.
Prepare the cucumber: thinly slice the cucumber and pat dry with paper towel to remove excess moisture so the tartine remains crisp.
Assemble base layer: spread a generous tablespoon or more of the crème fraîche mixture onto each toasted rye slice, leaving a small border.
Layer cucumber and trout: arrange overlapping cucumber slices on the spread, then top with flaked smoked trout distributed evenly across each slice.

Finish and garnish: scatter drained capers over the trout, sprinkle remaining chopped dill, a light pinch of sea salt, freshly ground black pepper, a small drizzle of olive oil and optional microgreens; finish with a light squeeze of lemon if desired.
Serve immediately so the toast stays crisp, or hold assembled tartines briefly on a wire rack at room temperature for up to 15 minutes before serving.
